title: It's All Invented
summary: Recognize that the frameworks and assumptions we use to interpret the world are invented, not absolute.

details.content: Our perceptions and beliefs shape our reality. By realizing these are constructed, we can choose more empowering perspectives.
Instead of assuming a colleague’s silence means disapproval, consider they may be preoccupied or shy.

content: Question your assumptions in challenging situations.
Ask yourself: What else could be true?
Invent alternative interpretations that open up possibilities.

title: Stepping into a Universe of Possibility
summary: Shift from a mindset of scarcity and competition to one of abundance and creativity.

details.content: A possibility mindset encourages innovation, collaboration, and growth, rather than limitation and fear.
Instead of competing for limited resources at work, explore ways to collaborate and create new opportunities.

content: Notice when you’re thinking in terms of limits or competition.
Ask: What new possibilities exist here?
Invite others to brainstorm without constraints.

title: Giving an A
summary: Approach others as if they are already performing at their best, fostering trust and growth.

details.content: When people feel seen for their potential, they are more likely to live up to it.
Treat a new team member as highly capable, encouraging them to contribute confidently.

content: Mentally ‘give an A’ to colleagues, friends, and family.
Acknowledge strengths and contributions.
Let go of judgment and focus on encouragement.

title: Being a Contribution
summary: Focus on how you can contribute, rather than what you can achieve or receive.

details.content: Seeing yourself as a contribution shifts focus from self-centered goals to collective benefit.
Offer your skills to help a project succeed, regardless of recognition or reward.

content: Ask: How can I contribute here?
Value your impact, not just outcomes.
Acknowledge the contributions of others.

title: Leading from Any Chair
summary: Leadership is not limited to those in authority; anyone can lead by taking initiative and inspiring others.

details.content: Empowering everyone to lead unleashes creativity and engagement.
A junior team member suggests a new process that improves workflow for everyone.

content: Encourage input from all team members.
Take initiative, regardless of your role.
Recognize leadership in others.

title: Rule Number 6
summary: Don’t take yourself so seriously; lighten up and let go of ego.

details.content: Humor and humility reduce stress, foster connection, and open up creative solutions.
Laugh at a mistake instead of getting defensive, making it easier to learn and move on.

content: Notice when you’re being overly serious.
Find humor in challenging situations.
Remind yourself: ‘Rule Number 6—Don’t take yourself so goddamn seriously.’

title: The Way Things Are
summary: Face reality as it is, without denial or complaint, as the starting point for possibility.

details.content: Acceptance allows for clear thinking and effective action, rather than being stuck in resistance.
Acknowledge a project setback honestly, then focus on solutions instead of blame.

content: Describe situations factually, without judgment.
Accept what is, then ask: What’s possible from here?
Let go of wishing things were different.

title: Giving Way to Passion
summary: Allow yourself to fully engage with what excites and energizes you.

details.content: Passion inspires others and brings energy and creativity to your work and life.
Share your enthusiasm for a new idea, motivating your team to get involved.

content: Notice what energizes you.
Express your excitement openly.
Encourage others to pursue their passions.

title: Lighting a Spark
summary: Inspire others by sharing your vision and inviting them to participate.

details.content: Inspiration is contagious; when you light a spark in others, you create momentum for change.
Invite your team to imagine what’s possible, sparking enthusiasm for a new project.

content: Share your vision with excitement.
Invite others to contribute their ideas.
Celebrate small wins to keep the spark alive.

title: Being the Board
summary: Take responsibility for your experience by seeing yourself as the board on which the game of life is played.

details.content: This mindset shifts you from victimhood to empowerment, enabling you to respond creatively.
Instead of blaming others for a conflict, ask how you are part of the situation and what you can change.

content: Ask: How am I the board for what’s happening?
Look for your role in every situation.
Focus on what you can influence.

title: Creating Frameworks for Possibility
summary: Design environments, structures, and conversations that foster creativity and new possibilities.

details.content: Intentional frameworks support innovation and help people move beyond limiting beliefs.
Establish ground rules for brainstorming that encourage wild ideas and suspend criticism.

content: Set up meetings to encourage open dialogue.
Create rituals that support creativity.
Regularly review and update frameworks to keep them fresh.

title: Telling the WE Story
summary: Shift from individual achievement to collective success by focusing on shared purpose and collaboration.

details.content: A ‘WE’ story unites people, builds trust, and amplifies impact.
Frame a team’s success as a result of everyone’s effort, not just individual contributions.

content: Use inclusive language (‘we’ instead of ‘I’ or ‘they’).
Highlight shared goals and values.
Celebrate collective achievements.
